list-item.p: The “true” equilibrium climate sensitivity is within one of the eight representative values in Fig. 4;
In 2010, the scientific knowledge regarding equilibrium climate sensitivity dictates that the eight values in Fig. 4 are evenly possible.

By the continuously accumulating scientific knowledge, the uncertainty will be reduced to 3/8 by 2040 and to 2/8 by 2050. In other words, the possible range of the equilibrium climate uncertainty is narrowed from range of all eight categories to that of three categories.
The remaining uncertainties will persist after 2100 but eventually the “true” equilibrium climate sensitivity will be revealed.
